result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
3:26  PM Defendant Larry L. Kurkowski in court.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy appears on behalf of Attorney Robert J Jambois for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Larry L. Kurkowski. 


ADA Cassidy calls the case and states the appearances.
Parties are ready to proceed.
3:27 p.m. Lt J Moss.
Direct examination by ADA Cassidy.
3:31 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.

BY THE COURT:
The record will reflect that the witness has identified the defendant.

3:33 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Bergner.
3:38 p.m.  Redirect by ADA Cassidy.
3:39 p.m.  Recross by Atty Bergner.
Court questions the witness with regards to clarification of the weapon used by the defendant.
3:41 p.m.  Clarification redirect by ADA Cassidy.
Atty Bergner has no additional recross.
Atty Bergner has no witnesses.
Witness is excused.
ADA Cassidy has no additional witnesses and gives a brief final argument.
Atty Bergner gives his final argument.
Atty Bergner would ask that the court dismiss Count 2.
ADA Cassidy responds to the request of Atty Bergner.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Bond is continued.
Court will not set this for an upcoming arraignment date as this is a Branch 2 case and it is uncertain if this case will 
remain with the Branch 2 Judge or assigned to another Judge.

1:47 PM Defendant Larry L. Kurkowski in court.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Larry L. Kurkowski. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Preliminary Hearing to be held within time limits.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for June 6, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with Frank and Ernie's Bar.

1:32 PM Defendant Larry L Kurkowski appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of WI.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Larry L Kurkowski. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of an Electric Weapons, Resisting an Officer, Disorderly Conduct. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
